Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to residency requirements for city employees
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Residency requirements for city employees.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the continued operation of the Stella D’Oro Biscuit Company in the Bronx and supporting the efforts of Local 50 and the workers at Stella D’Oro Biscuit Company to maintain their jobs and prevent the closure of the Bronx factory.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the continued operation of the Stella D’Oro Biscuit Company in the Bronx.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 992-A, in relation to the residency requirement for city employees.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Filed by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 992 - Residency requirements for city employees.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing of pedicabs.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Pedicab licensing.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A. 6807 and S. 3185 of 2009, which authorize political subdivisions to award public procurement contracts to participants of a minority and women owned business enterprise program at a cost premium not to exceed ten percent of the lowest bid.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Contracts
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following two Council Members formally voted against this item: 
Council Members Felder and Vallone, Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorize political subdivisions to award public procurement contracts to participants of a minority and women owned business enterprise program at a cost premium not to exceed 10% of the lowest bid.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact S.3514 and A.7369 of 2009, which authorize political subdivisions to award public competitively bid contracts to businesses that participate in programs designed to foster participation by small local businesses in public procurement at a cost premium not to exceed ten percent of the lowest bid.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Contracts
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally voted against this item: 
Council Member Felder.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorize political subdivisions to award public competitively bid contracts to businesses that participate in programs designed to foster participation by small local businesses. (S.3514/A.7369)
